thread.title: LG G6 press render and live image leaked again
thread.title_full: LG G6 press render and live image leaked again

title: LG G6 press render and live image leaked again
text:
LG G6 press render and live image leaked again LG G6 press render and live image leaked again By February 23, 2017 “The LG G6 will flaunt minimal bezels and a display with rounded corners” 
LG recently announced that it will be hosting its pre-MWC event on February 26th, where it will be introducing its latest flagship dubbed the LG G6. The company has been teasing some of the key specs of the phone for the past couple of weeks. We saw a couple of live images and press renders of the device as well. Now the popular gadget tipster Evan Blass has posted a new press render of the LG G6. In addition, an alleged live image of the device has also hit the interwebs. . @arash1kahedi Those were bothering the hell out of me, too. Fixed. pic.twitter.com/UZjqYNfoSV — Evan Blass (@evleaks) February 22, 2017 
As seen in the render, the LG G6 will sport minimal bezels on top and bottom of the display. It will sport a metallic frame and a glass back panel. The device will have dual rear cameras with a fingerprint sensor sitting beneath. The handset will offer rounded display corners and a taller than usual form factor. 
LG recently confirmed that the G6 will flaunt a 5.7-inch quad-HD+ FullVision display. The brand has teased the phone to be water-resistant, and confirmed the presence of a dual rear camera setup for the device. We will have its full details at the brand’s event on Sunday.
